result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert C. Leque Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 per month payment plan to commence on or before August 15, 2015

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert C. Leque Jr.

defendant.name: Leque, Robert C., Jr.
defendant.address: 469 E. 9th St., Fond Du Lac, WI 54935

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert C. Leque in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he did meet with the defendant for a pre-trial and an offer was provided.  In speaking with the defendant before court; the defendant would like to accept the offer.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement.    Defendant agrees with the agreement.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of Attorney.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $442.00
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in August
  Upon failure to pay fine, it will be 1 day in jail for every $50 due and owing.

with conditions:
*Appear for booking today
*No contact with Michael Mailhot

Defendant Robert C. Leque in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today
*No contact with Michael Mailhot

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set a Return with a pre-trial.  Return date scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
copy of letter D.A. sent defendant regarding Court date
